intro: Lepturus mildbraedianus, commonly known as the mildbraedian lichen, is a rare and specialized symbiotic organism composed of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic alga. It belongs to the family Pilocarpaceae and is characterized by its unique thallus structure, which is typically crust-like and tightly adherent to rock surfaces. This lichen thrives in cool, moist environments, often found on shaded, calcareous substrates in temperate regions. Its growth is slow, and it plays a crucial role in soil formation and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
